story:
About the situation in Calais

Everyone is aware of the immense humanitarian refugee crisis around but this crisis is happening just off the British shores. Calais and the camp called 'the jungle' has become an arrival point for hundreds of people on a daily basis.  You have seen seen the  desperate images of Syrian, Eritreans, Afghans, Sudanese (…the list continues) who escaped war torn countries, crossed deserts and mountains, survived Mediterranean & pan European crossings and finally made it to the English Channel in an attempt to climb a fence and jump on a running train. There are currently about 4,000 people living in inhumane conditions in Calais, mostly men but including women & young children. All desperately hungry and in need of urgent medical attention. Essentials that we take for granted, like food, women's sanitary products, clean underwear, toilet paper and toothbrushes are in extremely short supply. The only protections from the elements are basic tents and improvised shelters which have been built by the refugees themselves. To make matters worse, winter is just around the corner and I’m concerned about the lack of shoes, warm clothing and sleeping bags. With the oncoming of winter and the rainy season as well as a constant stream of new arrivals, the situation is only going to get worse!

Summary of planned action

Aside from arranging a donations drop outside of this campaign, I will be using the funds to purchase items for the people in the Calais camp, hiring a van and delivering these myself whilst spending a few days (23rd Oct onwards) in the jungle helping out, distributing, building, cooking etc.  The required essentials are:

  • Non perishable foods
  • Shelter - Tents, Sleeping bags, Blankets
  • Clothing & Shoes
  • Sanitary Supplies

Contacts

These are the organisations on the ground if you are looking to get in touch and inform yourself further. Please check their websites first as these guys are extremely busy with everything that is happening in Calais and may not have time to answer FAQ's.

http://www.laubergedesmigrants.fr and http://www.secours-catholique.org

The Impact

With the oncoming winter we are talking about saving lives and making them as bearable as only possible. Google the pictures and watch some of the videos being posted from the camps and you will understand why every single item is essential and makes a difference. 

Risks & Challenges

The situation in Calais is volatile and rapidly changing, I am in constant touch with the organisations on the ground to understand if requirements change to make sure that the delivery makes the biggest possible impact. Should anything change from a legal point of view making a journey to Calais impossible, the funds will be donated to one of the mentioned organisations. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, raise awareness, volunteer for a trip to Calais or to shop/ pack/ sort, get in touch with me for a donation drop. 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/CalaisMigrantSo...

Thank you all for your support!

story:
Presione aquí para Español!  



The Carehub is a communication device that contains sensors to alert you of issues that could affect your elderly relatives. 


We've developed a hardware prototype for this product, now we need to take it to the next level.


 

Two Way Communication: 

How many times have you tried to teach your parents to use Skype or FaceTime for a two way call…and failed?

With the Carehub it couldn’t be easier, mum presses the button on the top of the unit and calls straight through to the app. 

You pick up and choose to have a video or an audio call...no fiddly tech for grandma to figure out.

Carehub in the news




Motion/ Non-Motion Alert: 

Do you want an alert in the morning when mum gets up and makes breakfast? Or more importantly, do you want an alert if she doesn’t get up and trigger the motion sensors before 10am?



Critical Temperature Alert: 

In many countries, elderly people run a serious risk of illness or worse because their homes reach a critical temperature as they generally tolerate the conditions to save money on their energy bills. 

 

The Carehub can be set to alert you if your parent’s home has reached to a critical temperature so you can act quickly.



Reminder Alerts: 

The Carehub has this cool little feature to make sure your folks never forget those important things again...

You can record an audio message from your smartphone and set the times and days when this message should activate on the Carehub device.  There will be an audible beep from the Carehub and the LED will flash purple. Mum presses the button on the top of the device to listen to the reminder message.


Motion Activated Nightlight: 

To minimize the risk of night-time accidents the Carehub has a nightlight which is activated from the motion detector.


Local TF Card Storage: 

A lot of people have concerns over remote storage of home images. Many other cameras on the market use cloud storage video images and charge extra for subscribing for this. We keep it simple, the Carehub has local storage on a TF card which can be retrieved locally.


You can also capture images and video from the Carehub locally in your smartphone photo/video gallery.


What's the Backstory? 


Don Munro CEO, Efergy Technologies

'My brother and I work together developing energy monitoring products in China. This year whilst home alone in Scotland, our 75 year old mum fell and broke her collarbone and dislocated her shoulder and it took her a while to get in touch with anyone. After the shock of this we looked around for a product that would allow us to keep an eye on her in future and make sure she was safe. We couldn't find one so we thought we would develop it...

'We started on this project early this year and have been working with a hardware developer in China and are now confident we have the hardware solution. We're looking for help to fund the development of the app and also want to get the idea of the Carehub out there.

This campaign is important to us as we think this device could give peace of mind to many people who are in similar situations to us.'


The Hardware

The Carehub device is packed with sensors and hardware to give benefits to the elderly user...


The App

Here's an overview of how the Carehub device and app interact:

 

How does the Carehub shape up to it's competition?

We're confident that the Carehub contains more unique selling features than any other device/app on the market. Here's why....


 Why do we need you?

We're looking for $25,000 to make the Carehub a reality, we've already developed the hardware prototype, we need extra funding to:

  • Hardware tooling for mass production
  • Software development (Android & iOS)
  • Certification for CE/FCC/RCM

Budget calculation

  • Tooling for mass production: $10,000
  • Software development (Android & iOS): $8,000
  • Certification for CE/FCC/RCM: $7,000
  • Total: $25,000
You are vital to this campaign, with your support we can reach our goals.


Timeline

What's in it for you?

We have some great perks for anyone who supports this campaign. Everything from updates to office-dates! In between there are some great discounts available on the Carehub for early adopters.




Our Company

We've developed energy monitoring products for the last 9 years, so we have the experience in developing this type of technology.

We have a proven track record in developing energy monitoring products and have sold over 1.2m online energy monitoring products. We have experienced and qualified personnel and a distribution network ready for this product but believe the market for this is far wider than our energy monitoring products.

For more information on Efergy Technologies click here


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is to get the development of this product finished/tested and  onto the market.  We're 75% developed with the hardware and the app has been designed and is ready to be developed. 
With your help we can speed-up this process and bring the Carehub to market sooner.

The future plans

We've already got big plans for the Carehub. Once this campaign is over we have a 2nd stage development plan. This plan will integrate more features and hardware to suit the Carehub's primary functions.
We'll let you into a few of our future plans for this product:

Wearable Push-to-Call wrist band
It'll be even easier for the elderly to call the app. We're planning to develop a wristband with a simple BlueTooth push button that will activate the call feature. This way a call can be started from the comfort of an armchair.

Wearable Alert Button
If an elderly relative is in an emergency situation we want to develop a wearable alert button that will notify an 'alarm alert' when pressed, we're even looking at to do this with two-way comms from the wearable.

Wearable Health Checker
Want to keep an eye on your mum's blood pressure and other vital health stats? We're looking at some high quality health wearables that could give you daily reports of the health stats and alert you if something isn't right.

Please note these developments are being considered for the next stage of the development and aren't included in this campaign perk level. 

How to convince your parents about the Carehub?

We know that you want to take care and monitor your parents but they might have some worries about being remotely monitored. With the help of the people at Assisted Living CT, we've put together a guide on how to approach the subject.
Click here to get some tips.

                              FAQs

I hope we've covered everything here, if you're looking for more information please check out the frequently asked question document here.

Any ideas for the Carehub?

We want your suggestions! The Carehub is for people like you, please feel free to message us any suggestions you may have. All suggestions will be added to future development proposals.

The Carehub Squad

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you want to donate this time, please make some noise on this campaign by sharing it through through this page's share tools.

                Need a press release?

Click here to download our press release for the Carehub.

Thank you for your Support!

You can expect transparency and direct communication from us all the way. All 10  members of the squad give you their word that everything will be implemented as promised. We have big plans with this product. This is just the beginning!

   
Italiano

El Carehub es un dispositivo de comunicación que sirve para facilitar una comunicación más efectiva entre personas mayores y su familia. El Carehub también incluye diferentes tipos de sensores de forma que ayudan a prevenir riesgos de accidente y salud. 


Contamos con el apoyo de:


A la fecha de hoy, ya tenemos un prototipo pero ahora necesitamos dar el siguiente paso.


 

Comunicación de voz bidireccional: 

¿Cuántas veces has tratado de enseñar a tus padres cómo utilizar Skype?

Pues con el Carehub es muy fácil. Con simplemente apretar el botón de la parte superior del Carehub se establece una llamada que la recibe el App de tu móvil. 

A través del App tú decides si quieres aceptar y tener una conversación de voz o de video... ¡se acabaron las tediosas lecciones de tecnología!



Alerta de movimiento y de "no-movimiento": 

¿Quieres que te notifiquemos cuando papá se levanta por la mañana? O quizás te resulta más útil una notificación que te alerte de lo contrario, cuando no ha habido movimiento. El Carehub incluye ambas opciones.



Alerta de temperatura crítica: 

Los más mayores a veces corren el riesgo de enfermarse porque sus hogares están por encima o por debajo de ciertas temperaturas que denominamos críticas. Esto es más frecuente en las personas mayores porque pueden perder la sensibilidad de la temperatura pero también porque aceptan estas condiciones a cambio de ahorrar en la factura de la luz. 

 

Puedes configurar tu Carehub para que te envíe esta alerta cuando tú así lo desees. De esta forma tú puedes actuar de forma inmediata y prevenir riesgos de enfermedad.



Recordatorios y mensajes de voz programados: 

El Carehub incluye esta función para que tus padres no se olviden de cosas importantes...


Puedes grabar un mensaje de voz desde tu teléfono móvil y programarlo para que suene cuando tú quieras. En el momento programado el Carehub hará sonar un pitido (también mostrará una luz LED de color morado) y mamá entonces, apretando el boton del carehub, podrá escuchar tu mensaje.


Luz de noche: 

El Carehub se puede programar para que active una luz cuando hay movimiento por la noche. Esto sirve para minimizar el riesgo de accidentes por la noche.


Tarjeta de memoria: 

Hoy en día, son muchos los que se preocupan sobre el almacenaje remoto de videos domésticos. Otras cámaras en el mercado utilizan sistemas de memoria en la nube y cargan una subscripción a cambio. Nosotros hemos preferido mantener un sistema sencillo donde la información queda grabada solamente de forma local en la tarjeta de memoria.


Puedes también guardar imágenes y videos en tu smartphone desde el Carehub.


¿Cómo surge esta idea? 


Don Munro, Gerente Efergy Technologies

“Mi hermano y yo trabajamos juntos desarrollando productos de monitorización energética en China. Hace poco, nuestra madre de 75 años tuvo una caída y se fracturó la clavícula además de dislocarse un hombro; ya que vive sola en Escocia, se le hizo difícil contactar por ayuda de inmediato. Superado el shock de esta experiencia, comenzamos a buscar productos que nos permitiesen estar pendiente de ella en el futuro y darnos tranquilidad. No encontramos nada y por tanto se nos ocurrió que lo podíamos desarrollar nosotros mismos..."

"Empezamos este proyecto a principios de este año. Hemos trabajado con la ayuda de un diseñador de producto y ahora ya tenemos una solución de hardware. Buscamos ayuda para financiar el desarrollo del App y también queremos promover la ideal del producto."

"Esta campaña es importante para nosotros porque creemos que podría ayudar a muchas personas que están en una situación parecida a la nuestra"


El Hardware

El dispositivo Carehub incluye una serie de sensores y actuadores que sirven para dar un servicio y valor añadido a personas mayores y sus familiares.


La aplicación

A continuación una breve reseña de como interactúan el Carehub y la aplicación:



¿Cómo nos vemos respecto de la competencia?

El Carehub tiene particularidades únicas y estamos muy confiados de que es superior al resto de dispositivos y aplicaciones en el mercado. A continuación os explicamos por qué:



 ¿Por qué te necesitamos?

Estamos tratando de recaudar 25,000 dólares para hacer realidad nuestro proyecto. Ya hemos desarrollado la parte del hardware pero aun queda lo siguiente:

  • Molde del hardware para producción en masa
  • Desarrollo del software (Android & iOS)
  • Certificaciones CE/FCC/RCM

Cálculo de presupuesto

  • Molde: $10,000
  • Desarrollo del software (Android & iOS): $8,000
  • Certificaciones CE/FCC/RCM: $7,000
  • Total: $25,000
Eres clave para esta campaña y solo podremos hacer realidad nuestro objetivo con tu apoyo y confianza.


Cronología


¿Qué te podemos ofrecer a cambio?

Tenemos recompensas para aquellos que estén quieran colaborar con la campaña. Hay de todo, desde actualizaciones, pasando por descuentos, donaciones para causas benéficas y ¡hasta visitas VIP a nuestra oficina!




Nuestra empresa

Llevamos 9 años desarrollando productos para la monitorización y el ahorro de la energía por lo que experiencia en desarrollar tecnología no nos falta.

En estos 9 años, hemos vendido 1.2 millones de dispositivos de monitorización energética y nos hemos ganado el respeto de un nicho de mercado muy exigente. Tenemos experiencia y personal muy cualificado que se apoya en una red distribución a nivel global.

Para más información acerca de Efergy por favor ir aquí


Riesgos y desafíos

El reto mayor es terminar la fase de desarrollo de producto y testeo y la de lanzarlo al mercado. Estamos en una fase avanzada (75%) en el desarrollo del hardware y el diseño del App también está terminado. Solo nos hace falta desarrollar el App y certificar el producto. 
Con tu ayuda podremos acelerar este proceso y traer el Carehub al mercado antes.

Planes futuros

Tenemos grandes planes para el Carehub. Cuando esta campaña finalice tenemos ya planificado una segunda fase de desarrollo en el que integraremos más características y funciones.
A continuación explicamos alguno de estos planes:

Pulsera para llamada
Con la pulsera será aun más fácil realizar llamadas. La pulsera tendrá un botón Bluetooth que servirá para activar la llamada. De esta forma la llamada podrá realizarse desde la comodidad de un sillón.

Alarma Portátil
Queremos desarrollar una alarma portátil que envíe una notificación cuando sea presionada. La misma estaría pensada para casos de emergencia y estamos mirando de agregar comunicación bidireccional.

Pulsera inteligente
¿Quieres saber la presión arterial u otras estadísticas de salud de tu mam/papá? Tenemos planeado desarrollar pulseras que te puedan enviar informes sobre la salud de tus padres o de notificarte cuando algo va mal.

Los desarrollos de futuro no están incluidos en este primer modelo y por tanto las recompensas no incluyen estas características. 

¿Cómo convencer a tus padres de usar el Carehub?

Sabemos que quieres cuidar de ellos, pero honestamente, puede que les preocupe que los quieras tener vigilados todo el tiempo. Con la ayuda de la organización “Assisted Living CT” hemos elaborado una guía sobre como abordar el tema.
Click here Para obtener más información y consejos, haz clic aquí

                             

Preguntas Frecuentes

Esperamos haber cubierto todas tus inquietudes pero si necesitas más detalles por favor revisa el documento en este enlace. Ver enlace

¿Algunas ideas para el Carehub?

Envíanos tus sugerencias! El Carehub es para la gente como tú. Si tienes algún tipo de feedback y/o sugerencias, por favor ponte en contacto con nosotros. Tomaremos muy en serio tus sugerencias y las añadiremos en futuras versiones.

La brigada Carehub



Otras formas de ayudar

No te preocupes si no quieres participar esta vez… pero te agradeceríamos mucho si hicieses un poco de ruido, por ejemplo compartiéndola con tus contactos a través de las opciones de esta página.

¿Quieres ver nuestro comunicado de prensa?

Haga clic aquí para descargar nuestro comunicado de prensa.

¡Gracias por tu apoyo!

De nuestra parte puedes esperar transparencia, honestidad y claridad. Todos nosotros te damos nuestra palabra de que todo será implementado como lo hemos prometido. Tenemos muchos y grandes planes con este producto…. ¡¡esto es solo el comienzo!!

Perks

Colaborador $5
Participa en el desarrollo del Carehub. Danos tu feedback y recibe actualizaciones regularm

Apóyanos y ahorra! $30
Apóyanos con el Carehub y una vez el producto esté en el mercado, te daremos un código con un 5% de descuento para cualquier compra en efergy.com.

Iniciativa sin ánimo de lucro - Opcion 1 $50
Si donas US $50, nosotros ponemos la diferencia y enviaremos un Carehub a una residencia de ancianos (puedes recomendarnos a cuál). Por esta ayuda te daremos también un 10% de descuento para futuras compras del Carehub.

Iniciativa sin ánimo de lucro - Opcion 2 $100
Ayúdanos a regalar 100 Carehubs a familias o residencias de ancianos alrededor del mundo. Por apoyar esta causa te daremos también un 10% de descuento para futuras compras del Carehub.

Reserva anticipada $249
Te garantizamos que serás de los primeros en recibir un Carehub. Te mantendremos informado de los avances del proyecto,  pediremos tu feedback y obtendrás el App del Carehub de forma gratuita. También conseguirás portes de envío gratuitos en Europa, Australia y EEUU; los envíos al resto del mundo cuestan US $30.

¡Dos para mi! $475
Muchos nos han dicho que quieren 2 Carehubs en lugar de uno pará así poder monitorizar dos habitaciones. Esta oferta que incluye un 5% de descuento en la compra de dos unidades, además de portes gratuitos en Europa, Australia y EEUU y la obtención del App del Carehub completamente GRATIS. Los envíos al resto del mundo cuestan US $30.

Beta Tester $500
¿Eres un crack de la tecnología? Sé de los primeros en testar el Carehub antes de su salida al mercado, e involúcrate en el proceso. En principio, te mandaremos una unidad en marzo y te contactaremos luego para que nos des tu feedback.

una vez hechas las pruebas, te mandaremos un Carehub completamente nuevo, incluyendo el App y portes de envío, completamente GRATIS. Los portes serán gratis en Europa, Australia y EEUU; los envíos al resto del mundo cuestan US $30.

  

¡Descuento del 10%! $2,241
Compra una caja de 10 unidades del Carehub y te daremos un 10% de descuento. Además obtendrás portes gratuitos en Europa, Australia y EEUU y la obtención del App para el Carehub completamente gratis. Los envíos al resto del mundo cuestan US $30.

Empresa / Tienda $5,290
¿Tienes una tienda? ¿Eres responsable o gestor que implique el cuidado de personas mayores?

¡Esta es la oferta para ti!

Te mantendremos informado de los avances del proyecto,  pediremos tu feedback y obtendrás el App del Carehub de forma gratuita. También conseguirás portes de envío gratuitos en Europa, Australia y EEUU; los envíos al resto del mundo cuestan US $30.

Consigue 25 Carehubs con un 15% de descuento sobre el PVP $8,715

Pack para distribuidores
Consigue 50 Carehubs con un 30% de descuento sobre el PVP.

Te mantendremos informado de los avances del proyecto,  pediremos tu feedback y obtendrás el App del Carehub de forma gratuita. También conseguirás portes de envío gratuitos en Europa, Australia y EEUU; los envíos al resto del mundo cuestan US $30.
story_txt:
Presione aquí para Español!  

The Carehub is a communication device that contains sensors to alert you of issues that could affect your elderly relatives. 



We've developed a hardware prototype for this product, now we need to take it to the next level.















 
Two Way Communication: 

How many times have you tried to teach your parents to use
Skype or FaceTime for a two way call…and failed?
With the Carehub it couldn’t be easier, mum presses the button
on the top of the unit and calls straight through to the app. 



You pick up and
choose to have a video or an audio call...no fiddly tech for
grandma to figure out.

Carehub in the news







Motion/ Non-Motion Alert: 
Do you want an alert in the morning when mum gets up and makes breakfast? Or more importantly, do you want an alert if she doesn’t get up and trigger the motion sensors
before 10am?







Critical Temperature Alert: 

In
many countries, elderly people run a serious risk of illness or worse because
their homes reach a critical temperature as they generally tolerate the
conditions to save money on their energy bills.  

The
Carehub can be set to alert you if your parent’s home has reached to a critical
temperature so you can act quickly.






Reminder
Alerts: 


The Carehub has this cool little feature to make sure your folks
never forget those important things again...




You can record an audio message from your smartphone and set the times and days when this message should activate on the Carehub device.  There will be an audible beep from the Carehub and the LED will flash purple. Mum presses the button on the top of the device to listen to the reminder message.

Motion Activated Nightlight: 
To minimize the risk of night-time accidents the Carehub has a nightlight which is activated from the
motion detector.





Local TF Card Storage: 

A lot of people have concerns over remote storage of home images. Many other cameras on the market use cloud storage video images and charge extra for subscribing for this. We keep it simple, the Carehub has local storage on a TF card which can be retrieved locally.




You can also capture images and video from the Carehub locally in your smartphone photo/video gallery.




What's the Backstory? 

Don Munro CEO, Efergy Technologies
'My brother and I work together developing energy monitoring products in China. This year whilst home alone in Scotland, our 75 year old mum fell and broke her collarbone and dislocated her shoulder and it took her a while to get in touch with anyone. After the shock of this we looked around for a product that would allow us to keep an eye on her in future and make sure she was safe. We couldn't find one so we thought we would develop it...


'We started on this project early this year and have been working with a hardware developer in China and are now confident we have the hardware solution. We're looking for help to fund the development of the app and also want to get the idea of the Carehub out there.
This campaign is important to us as we think this device could give peace of mind to many people who are in similar situations to us.'


The HardwareThe Carehub device is packed with sensors and hardware to give benefits to the elderly user...








The App

Here's an overview of how the Carehub device and app interact:


 



How does the Carehub shape up to it's competition?
We're confident that the Carehub contains more unique selling features than any other device/app on the market. Here's why....






 Why do we need you?


We're looking for $25,000 to make the Carehub a reality, we've already developed the hardware prototype, we need extra funding to:

Hardware tooling for mass production
Software development (Android & iOS)
Certification for CE/FCC/RCM


Budget calculation

Tooling for mass production: $10,000
Software development (Android & iOS): $8,000
Certification for CE/FCC/RCM: $7,000
Total: $25,000

You are vital to this campaign, with your support we can reach our goals.


Timeline








What's in it for you?

We have some great perks for anyone who supports this campaign. Everything from updates to office-dates! In between there are some great discounts available on the Carehub for early adopters.






   
Our Company
We've developed energy monitoring products for the last 9 years, so we have the experience in developing this type of technology.
We have a proven track record in developing energy monitoring products and have sold over 1.2m online energy monitoring products. We have experienced and qualified personnel and a distribution network ready for this product but believe the market for this is far wider than our energy monitoring products.
For more information on Efergy Technologies click here   
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge is to get the development of this product finished/tested and  onto the market.  We're 75% developed with the hardware and the app has been designed and is ready to be developed. 
With your help we can speed-up this process and bring the Carehub to market sooner.


The future plans

We've already got big plans for the Carehub. Once this campaign is over we have a 2nd stage development plan. This plan will integrate more features and hardware to suit the Carehub's primary functions.
We'll let you into a few of our future plans for this product:


Wearable Push-to-Call wrist bandIt'll be even easier for the elderly to call the app. We're planning to develop a wristband with a simple BlueTooth push button that will activate the call feature. This way a call can be started from the comfort of an armchair.


Wearable Alert ButtonIf an elderly relative is in an emergency situation we want to develop a wearable alert button that will notify an 'alarm alert' when pressed, we're even looking at to do this with two-way comms from the wearable.


Wearable Health CheckerWant to keep an eye on your mum's blood pressure and other vital health stats? We're looking at some high quality health wearables that could give you daily reports of the health stats and alert you if something isn't right.

Please note these developments are being considered for the next stage of the development and aren't included in this campaign perk level. 


How to convince your parents about the Carehub?
We know that you want to take care and monitor your parents but they might have some worries about being remotely monitored. With the help of the people at Assisted Living CT, we've put together a guide on how to approach the subject.
Click here to get some tips.
                              FAQs
I hope we've covered everything here, if you're looking for more information please check out the frequently asked question document here.


Any ideas for the Carehub?
We want your suggestions! The Carehub is for people like you, please feel free to message us any suggestions you may have. All suggestions will be added to future development proposals.




The Carehub Squad


Other Ways You Can Help



 Don't worry if you want to donate this time, please make some noise on this campaign by sharing it through through this page's share tools.

                Need a press release?
Click here to download our press release for the Carehub.

Thank you for your Support!
You can expect transparency and direct communication from us all the way. All 10  members of the squad give you their word that everything will be implemented as promised. We have big plans with this product. This is just the beginning!

Sabemos que quieres cuidar de ellos, pero honestamente, puede que les preocupe que los quieras tener vigilados todo el tiempo. Con la ayuda de la organización “Assisted Living CT” hemos elaborado una guía sobre como abordar el tema. 
Click here Para obtener más información y consejos, haz clic aquí
                             
Preguntas Frecuentes
Esperamos haber cubierto todas tus inquietudes pero si necesitas más detalles por favor revisa el documento en este enlace. Ver enlace



¿Algunas ideas para el Carehub?
Envíanos tus sugerencias! El Carehub es para la gente como tú. Si tienes algún tipo de feedback y/o sugerencias, por favor ponte en contacto con nosotros. Tomaremos muy en serio tus sugerencias y las añadiremos en futuras versiones.




La brigada Carehub







 Otras formas de ayudar



 No te preocupes si no quieres participar esta vez… pero te agradeceríamos mucho si hicieses un poco de ruido, por ejemplo compartiéndola con tus contactos a través de las opciones de esta página.
¿Quieres ver nuestro comunicado de prensa?
Haga clic aquí para descargar nuestro comunicado de prensa.

 ¡Gracias por tu apoyo!
 De nuestra parte puedes esperar transparencia, honestidad y claridad. Todos nosotros te damos nuestra palabra de que todo será implementado como lo hemos prometido. Tenemos muchos y grandes planes con este producto…. ¡¡esto es solo el comienzo!!

feedback y recibe actualizaciones regularm

vez el producto esté en el mercado, te daremos un código con un 5% de descuento

Carehub de forma gratuita. También conseguirás portes de envío gratuitos en
Europa, Australia y EEUU; los envíos al resto del mundo cuestan US $30.

de uno pará así poder monitorizar dos habitaciones. Esta oferta que incluye un
5% de descuento en la compra de dos unidades, además de portes gratuitos en

una vez hechas las pruebas, te mandaremos un

story:
The Campaign

Alpha Epsilon--Corporate has been fortunate enough to be able to fund its own projects in the past through funds allocated from Chapter dues. However, due to the shortage of funds in the past 5 years, the house is in need of repairs that are cannot be wholly covered through chapter dues. It is currently suffering some structural damages that need to be fixed in order to maintain our beloved home at its optimal state and allow future generations of brothers to have the same amazing experience we have had. 

Your efforts and donations in that past have made a great impact on our house. In 2016, collegiate brothers repainted the main rooms in the house. In 2015, the chapter room was repainted. In 2013, all the bathrooms were remodeled. We have big goals to improve the house over the coming years and restore it to its former glory so that we can all enjoy it. However, to accomplish our goals, we will need your help.

 

Use of Funds:

Your donations will all be utilized to make improvements to the house that will increase its longevity. We are desperate need of professional work to improve our structure of the house. Beneath is the first major project the chapter would like to tackle, as well as a few additional projects we will begin work on with any excess donations: 

Primary Projects

  • Office Remodeling
  • Window Replacement

Secondary Projects

  • Roof shingle replacement
  • Replacing ceiling tiles in the Chapter Room
  • Repairing damaged gutters and gathering materials for installation of French Drain system

Other Ways You Can Help: 

If you prefer to donate physical items, we are also accepting donations for the following items: 

  • Cleaning supplies (clorox wipes, bleach, Simple Green, sponges, mops, brooms, Swiffer  Wet Jet supplies) 
  • Ceiling Tiles 
  • Furniture (New or gently used chairs, tables, or sofas)

**Please contact the Vice President of Alumni Relations (alumnialphaepsilon@gmail.com) for more information regarding this type of donation. 

Our primary project this semester is to repair the office. While we are still able to use the space effectively, there is water damage in the ceiling and repairs that could be made to the ceiling fan and windows that would allow us to really maximize the use of this space. We believe that repairing the office will help build our brotherhood further by giving us a great study space to meet and work together.

Below are pictures of the damage we are trying to fix with the help of your donations: 

 

 

 

 

The Perks

$25 Donor Recognition in the Alumni Newsletter

$35 Koozie + Donor Recognition

$50- Exclusive Alumni T-shirt + Donor Recognition

 

$70- T-shirt + Koozie + Donor Recognition

$150- T-shirt + Koozie+ Raffle for 2 tickets to a UGA Football first home game + Donor Recognition

Your name will be entered into a raffle for TWO UGA football tickets to the opening home game this fall. You will also receive an exclusive Alumni shirt, AE Koozie, and donor recognition in The Alpha Ep newsletter.

$250 - Engraved Name/Class Year Plate on Exterior Brick

A brass plate engraved with your name and class year will be placed on the exterior brick with other alumni donors. You will also receive an exclusive Alumni shirt, AE Koozie, entrance in the UGA football tickets raffle and donor recognition in The Alpha Ep newsletter.

$500 - "Friends of AKPsi" Plaque in Chapter Room

A special plaque with donor names will be displayed in the Chapter Room. You will also receive an exclusive Alumni shirt, AE Koozie, entrance in the UGA football game tickets raffle, and donor recognition in The Alpha Ep newsletter.

story:
Unlike most IOT products, Remootio comes with built-in Bluetooth and WiFi connectivity, which means that you do not need a separate bridge to make a Bluetooth product WiFi compatible. With Remootio you can control your gates and garage doors from anywhere in the world.

The 256 bit authenticated end-to-end encryption between the Remootio device and your smartphone ensures that only you and people you have shared a key with can operate or monitor your gates.

Keys are only stored in your smartphone and the Remootio device itself and not somewhere in the cloud so you don't have to worry about security.

Since Remootio does not require big and costly servers thanks to the end-to-end encryption technology, there are no operational costs for Remootio users.

We have made our App very easy-to use. Everything is exactly where you expect it to be.

Thanks to Remootio's Bluetooth connectivity, you can control your gates even when WiFi is not available at your gates or when the internet service is down.

You can also connect Remootio to your home WiFi and control your gates from anywhere within your house. In this mode, no data goes through the internet.

Thanks to Remootio's internet connectivity, you can control and monitor your gates from anywhere in the world. You can setup internet access easily with a simple click in the Remootio App.
 

Remootio is also compatible with Alexa, so you can ask her to close or open the gate for you and you may also ask her if your gates are left open. If you wish to use Alexa with Remootio, choose the version with the sensor add-on so that Remootio (and therefore Alexa) is aware of your gate's status.

 

 

You can easily share keys with family and friends or even Airbnb guests via QR code or via text message. (You can also use the messaging platform of any social media apps to share keys).

 

 

  • Remootio comes with
    • a guest key (this can be shared with an unlimited number of people)
    • and 20 unique keys which you can manage one by one in a simple, easy to understand table
      • If our Indiegogo project reaches USD 25.000, we give a key upgrade to 100 keys to all Indiegogo backers!

You can get notifications when certain keyholders (such as your children or your gardener for instance) operated the gate so that you know when they arrived and when they left. You may also revoke access any time by long-pressing the name of the keyholder and selecting "delete". To rename a keyholder, long-press the name and select "rename".

Remootio can open the gates automatically as you approach them if you turn on the auto-open feature in the Remootio app.

​

You can check whether your gate is open or closed from the Remootio app any time. This feature requires the sensor to be installed.

Remootio can send you notifications in the following cases:

  • A certain key holder operated the gate. For example you would like to know when your child arrives home 

  • Someone rang the doorbell

  • A gate is left open for 5 minutes

You can add as many Remootio devices as you wish and simply swipe between them in the app:

In order to make Remootio compatible with as many gate openers as possible we have designed its power unit to work with a very wide input voltage range both with direct and alternating current:

  • Direct current: 6-36V (polarity independent)
  • Alternating current: 12-24V

 

The only requirement besides the voltage range is that the power supply must be able to provide 500mA current to the Remootio device.

Most gate opener electronics fall in the voltage range of Remootio, but if yours is different you can still get the Remootio power adapter, which you may use with the standard EU type 230V or US type 110V sockets.

From the Remootio app you can easily rename, add a photo and select a background color for each gate and garage door so that you can easily find it when you are swiping through your devices.

       

In order to make Remootio accessible for everyone, the Remootio app is available in multiple languages, such as:

  • English
  • German
  • French
  • Spanish
  • Italian

and there are more languages to be added soon.

Thanks to its small dimensions, Remootio fits just about anywhere.

 

You don't have to get rid of your old remote control yet. You can connect Remootio in parallel with the receiver unit of your old remote controller and keep using both.

When it comes to devices that can open and monitor your gates and doors, security is extremely important, that's why we have put so much thought and effort into Remootio's security:

  • Independently from whether you use Bluetooth or WiFi, Remootio uses 256 bit authenticated end-to-end encryption between your smartphone and the Remootio device
  • From the Remootio app you have full control over how your smartphone connects to your Remootio device. You can choose from three options:
    • ​Bluetooth: in this mode Remootio only uses its Bluetooth module. No data goes through your WiFi network in this mode. On top of the standard Bluetooth security, the authenticated 256 bit end-to-end encryption ensures security in this mode.
    • Home WiFi: in this mode Remootio only uses its WiFi module without Bluetooth. No data goes through the internet. All data remains within your home WiFi network.
      The authenticated 256 bit end-to-end encryption also ensures security in this mode.
    • Internet: in this mode Remootio is connected to the internet via WiFi. On top of the industry standard SSL connection, the authenticated 256 bit end-to-end encryption guarantees security in this mode. We have created a one-click-setup-environment for setting up the internet connectivity (recommended for most users), but if you are an experienced user you can also define the internet address of your device in the App to setup a peer-to-peer connection.
  • Keys are generated during setup and are only stored on your smartphone and the Remootio device itself. Your keys are not stored anywhere else.
  • Even the setup process is protected against hackers trying to get your virtual keys as it uses the highly secure, state-of-the-art Ephemeral Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman key exchange method, which together with the additional certificate validation and digital signature scheme, is resistant to eavesdropping, man-in-the-middle and other attacks.
  • Remootio, unlike other gate controllers, is not cloud-based, so your security does not depend on a third party (such as a cloud service provider)
  • Any time your smartphone sends a request to the Remootio device, it sends a unique mathematical problem back to the smartphone which it can only solve using the key the two devices agreed on during setup. Since this mathematical problem is always different, signals for two opening cycles are never the same, therefore Remootio is protected against replay attacks. (It means that even if a hacker eavesdrops the communication between your smartphone and the Remootio device, and replays it to the Remootio device, the hacker won't be able to open your gates)

Remootio is compatible with most garage door and gate openers as well as several electromagnetic locks. Remootio's output for controlling the gates is a normally open relay output.
Hint: If your gate or garage door supports a manual open button (wall button) feature, it is definitely compatible with Remootio. Even if it doesn't have this feature, it can still be compatible. Please check our non-comprehensive compatibility list or send us an e-mail with the brand and type of your gate or garage door to support@remootio.com.

Garage doors

Swing gates

Sliding gates

Electromagnetic locks

All you need for installation is a cross head screwdriver, a smartphone and the Remootio device.

 

 

    To make Remootio even better, you can add some useful accessories such as a:

    You can connect your existing doorbell or any "normally open" type buttons to Remootio's doorbell input and get notifications on your smartphone if someone presses this button.

    You can enable or disable a manual control button from the Remootio app, which the courier or your friends can use to let themselves in until the button is in enabled status. The button you  connect can be any "normally open" type buttons.

     

    Connect a status sensor to get feedback about whether your gate or garage door is open or closed. Mount the part with the cable to a static (not moving) part of your gate and the wireless part to the moving part of your gate in a way that either in the completely closed or completely opened position the two parts are facing each other as seen below and the distance between them is not more than 10mm. No batteries are needed for the sensor.

    If the output voltage of your existing gate controller is not within the range of 6-36VDC or 6-25VAC or if it cannot provide at least 500mA current, you will need a power adapter. Currently three versions are available: Type A (US), type C (EU) and a universal power adapter which is compatible with both type I (Australia, New Zealand) and type G (UK, UAE) sockets.

    Since Indiegogo doesn't let us change the perks after they are claimed, please select either a US or an EU type adapter and if your shipping address is in a country where type I or type G sockets are used, we will contact you after the campaign by e-mail to confirm which type of adapter you wish to receive.

    Select the perks with multiple items and save on shipping!

    Included in the box:

    • 1x Remootio device
    • 1x power cable (to power the Remootio device from your gate's or garage door's power output)
    • 1x connection cable (to connect the Remootio device to your gate or garage door)
    • 1x double-sided tape
    • 1x instruction manual

    Included in the box:

    • 1x Remootio device
    • 1x sensor for detecting if your gate or garage door is open or closed
    • 1x power cable (to power to the Remootio device from your gate's or garage door's power output)
    • 1x connection cable (to connect the Remootio device to your gate or garage door)
    • 1x double-sided tape
    • 1x instruction manual

    Included in the box:

    • 1x Remootio power adapter suitable for "type C sockets" (this type is widely used in the EU) with 1.50m cable.

    When selecting a perk which includes a power adapter you will be prompted to choose the type you wish to receive (Select Type A for US and Type C for EU sockets).

    Included in the box:

    • 1x Remootio power adapter suitable for "type A" sockets (this type is widely used in the US) with 1.50m cable.

    When selecting a perk which includes a power adapter you will be prompted to choose the type you wish to receive (Select Type A for US and Type C for EU sockets).

    We have tested Remootio for 5 million opening cycles and it was still working perfectly fine when we stopped the test.

    If you open your gate or garage door 100 times every day for a hundred years, it's still less than 4 million opening cycles.

    If we reach USD 25.000 we will send all of our Indiegogo backers a key extension pack, which increases the number of keys from 20 to 100.

    If we reach USD 50.000 we will create the Apple Watch App

    If we reach USD 75.000, we will make Remootio Google Home compatible. 

    In order to protect your Remootio from any damages during delivery, we use strong, recycled secondary packaging for shipping.

     

    Remootio is available in stock so you don't have to wait months to receive yours! After the campaign, we will start delivering the products right away!

    We have teamed up with FedEx & TNT and the postal services to make sure your Remootio package gets to you as quick as possible no matter where you are in the world.

    Select the perks with multiple items and save on shipping!

     

     

    Remootio is already in production phase and the products are available in stock. We will start shipping the products from stock right after the campaign is over. If the Indiegogo orders exceed our stock, we will start a new production run to keep up with the demand. 

    Remootio has been tested in various circumstances, however, it is impossible to test its compatibility with all gate opener brands and types. If you are unsure about whether Remootio works with your existing gate or garage door opener, please check the non-comprehensive compatibility list by clicking the link below. If you can't find the brand or type of your gate opener in the list, please feel free to ask us at support@remootio.com (please add the word "compatibility" in the subject of the e-mail for faster processing). 

    Please click on the files below to download them:

    • Technical datasheet
    • Non-comprehensive compatibility list
    • Installation Guide

Please check our non-comprehensive compatibility list or send us an e-mail with the brand and type of your gate or garage door to support@remootio.com.Garage doorsSwing gatesSliding gatesElectromagnetic locksAll you need for installation is a cross head screwdriver, a smartphone and the Remootio device.  To make Remootio even better, you can add some useful accessories such as a:You can connect your existing doorbell or any "normally open" type buttons to Remootio's doorbell input and get notifications on your smartphone if someone presses this button.You can enable or disable a manual control button from the Remootio app, which the courier or your friends can use to let themselves in until the button is in enabled status. The button you  connect can be any "normally open" type buttons. Connect a status sensor to get feedback about whether your gate or garage door is open or closed. Mount the part with the cable to a static (not moving) part of your gate and the wireless part to the moving part of your gate in a way that either in the completely closed or completely opened position the two parts are facing each other as seen below and the distance between them is not more than 10mm. No batteries are needed for the sensor.If the output voltage of your existing gate controller is not within the range of 6-36VDC or 6-25VAC or if it cannot provide at least 500mA current, you will need a power adapter. Currently three versions are available: Type A (US), type C (EU) and a universal power adapter which is compatible with both type I (Australia, New Zealand) and type G (UK, UAE) sockets.Since Indiegogo doesn't let us change the perks after they are claimed, please select either a US or an EU type adapter and if your shipping address is in a country where type I or type G sockets are used, we will contact you after the campaign by e-mail to confirm which type of adapter you wish to receive.Select the perks with multiple items and save on shipping!Included in the box:
1x Remootio device
1x power cable (to power the Remootio device from your gate's or garage door's power output)
1x connection cable (to connect the Remootio device to your gate or garage door)
1x double-sided tape
1x instruction manual
Included in the box:
1x Remootio device
1x sensor for detecting if your gate or garage door is open or closed
1x power cable (to power to the Remootio device from your gate's or garage door's power output)
1x connection cable (to connect the Remootio device to your gate or garage door)
1x double-sided tape
1x instruction manual
Included in the box:1x Remootio power adapter suitable for "type C sockets" (this type is widely used in the EU) with 1.50m cable.When selecting a perk which includes a power adapter you will be prompted to choose the type you wish to receive (Select Type A for US and Type C for EU sockets).Included in the box:1x Remootio power adapter suitable for "type A" sockets (this type is widely used in the US) with 1.50m cable.When selecting a perk which includes a power adapter you will be prompted to choose the type you wish to receive (Select Type A for US and Type C for EU sockets).We have tested Remootio for 5 million opening cycles and it was still working perfectly fine when we stopped the test.If you open your gate or garage door 100 times every day for a hundred years, it's still less than 4 million opening cycles.If we reach USD 25.000 we will send all of our Indiegogo backers a key extension pack, which increases the number of keys from 20 to 100.If we reach USD 50.000 we will create the Apple Watch AppIf we reach USD 75.000, we will make Remootio Google Home compatible. In order to protect your Remootio from any damages during delivery, we use strong, recycled secondary packaging for shipping. Remootio is available in stock so you don't have to wait months to receive yours! After the campaign, we will start delivering the products right away!We have teamed up with FedEx & TNT and the postal services to make sure your Remootio package gets to you as quick as possible no matter where you are in the world.Select the perks with multiple items and save on shipping!  Remootio is already in production phase and the products are available in stock. We will start shipping the products from stock right after the campaign is over. If the Indiegogo orders exceed our stock, we will start a new production run to keep up with the demand. Remootio has been tested in various circumstances, however, it is impossible to test its compatibility with all gate opener brands and types. If you are unsure about whether Remootio works with your existing gate or garage door opener, please check the non-comprehensive compatibility list by clicking the link below. If you can't find the brand or type of your gate opener in the list, please feel free to ask us at support@remootio.com (please add the word "compatibility" in the subject of the e-mail for faster processing). Please click on the files below to download them:
Technical datasheet
Non-comprehensive compatibility list
Installation Guide

story:
Picture your lunch. Do dry uninspiring sandwiches and disappointing microwaved leftovers sound familiar? For us here at Glasshouse it certainly did, so we set out to change it. We had an idea; what if you could use your microwave to grill, poach, fry and bake to perfection, delivering the home-cooked taste you love. That is what MICO gives you, lunches and snacks beautifully cooked in a fraction of the time.

 

MICO is the new method in your microwave. You’ve never cooked like this before; delicious toasties, grilled to perfection, poached and fried eggs with beautifully runny yolks, baked potatoes; crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, all from your humble microwave.

 

 

HOW IT WORKS

 


This is possible thanks to new HeatWave Technology
that harnesses the microwave power to deliver
conventional cooking and turns microwaved food from
disappointment to delight.
With MICO, it’s not just your microwave's turntable that’s revolutionary.

 

TOASTIE

A delicious toasted sandwich is a perfect meal or snack. Melted cheese, coupled with meat, tomato or whatever you fancy can turn the humble sandwich into an indulgent delight. To achieve this you've previously had to use a cumbersome toasted sandwich maker; not exactly something you can take to the office with you.

MICO Toastie changes this, sandwiched between the cool-touch silicone outer are metal plates with added HeatWave Technology. This converts the microwaves into conventional grill cooking, meaning your microwave can now beautifully toast your sandwich.

 

POTATO

Baked potatoes crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside; the perfect meal. Until now, the only way to make a baked potato is to oven cook for hours, or cook in a microwave and have a soggy mess instead of the ideal crisp potato you crave.

With MICO Potato, you can achieve an oven-cooked taste in just 18 minutes in your microwave. The HeatWave Technology is able to use microwaves to simultaneously cook inside to perfection and crisp up the outside.

 

 

 

EGGS

A sumptuous runny yolk of a poached or fried egg is something to savour, but if you've ever tried to make one in a microwave you'll know only too well the state they often come out in; hard and devoid of flavour.

MICO Egg is the solution to beautifully microwaved eggs with runny yolks in a fraction of the time. The new HeatWave Technology is able to use microwaves to poach or fry eggs in minutes.

 

 

COOKING TIMES

 

 

 

PRODUCT USABILITY

Simply load your sandwich into the MICO Toastie and microwave for 6-8 minutes. What comes out is a perfectly grilled toasted sandwich that takes your lunch to the next level.

 

Simply pop your potato in the MICO Potato and microwave for 7-8 minutes with the lid off and place the lid on for an extra 10-11 minutes. That’s all it takes to have a baked potato cooked beautifully to oven quality.

 

Simply crack eggs into the two egg pods within the MICO Egg (with water if you are poaching) and microwave for 3-4 minutes. In that short space of time you’ll create perfect poached or fried eggs, for a lunch on-the-go with no compromise on the taste.

 

 

PRODUCT FEATURES

 

DISHWASHER SAFE

What’s more all parts are dishwasher safe, so the only thing quicker than making your delicious snack is cleaning up afterwards.

 

TAKE IT WITH YOU

The silicone designs are no bigger than a small lunchbox, so it’s perfect for taking with you to the office to spruce up those drab lunchtimes forever.

 

PRODUCT DIMENSIONS

 

DEVELOPMENT PROCESS





 


PROTOTYPE TESTING

MICO Toastie  Grilled cheese sandwich

 

MICO Egg  Poached eggs

 

MICO Egg  Fried eggs

 

MICO Potato  Baked potatoes

  

WHO WE ARE

Welcome to a new way of thinking! Glasshouse is the innovation centre of excellence backed by Morphy Richards, a household name in kitchen appliances. With a dedicated team of developers and engineers here at Glasshouse we look at the heart of what consumers truly need to make any kitchen task easier and quicker. We create solutions by thinking outside of the box looking at new technologies and new methods to give the consumer the best product solution possible.

We have some amazing ideas here at Glasshouse, but only the really special ones make it. An idea can only be successful if you, the consumer, believe in it as much as we do. That’s why we want you to be part of the decision making, after all the best way to find out if our product solutions are what consumers want is to give you the chance to buy them, before we make hundreds of thousands of them.

Our mission is to deliver never seen before product solutions to enhance kitchen tasks. Our team of experts work collaboratively at every stage from insight to concept to design to test to build and ultimately sell.  

 

I HAVE A QUESTION...!

We have tried to answer all the questions you may have below, but feel free to get in touch if you have any burning questions or comments.

Why is the Mico range so special?

Q: I thought you weren’t supposed to put metal in a microwave oven?

A: Don’t worry our designers have ensured that the Mico range is safe as long as you put it together correctly. As long as metals don’t touch then this is perfectly safe, after all the inside of your microwave oven is made of metal too!

Q: How does food become crispy in Mico and not soggy like other microwave cookware?

A: The principle behind Mico is to shield the microwaves from the food by using metal plates.  Without Heatwave Technology the microwaves would simply bounce around the microwave oven and the food would not heat up.  With Heatwave Technology the microwaves are not deflected away but absorbed and heat the metal plates very rapidly like a traditional heating element, essentially cooking food by conduction and thus creates a crispy grilled appearance on your food.

Q:  How does Heatwave Technology regulate the temperature?

A:  Each Mico appliance has Heatwave Technology applied in a different way.  Our engineers have produced many prototypes to ensure the technology is positioned correctly and the heat is focused in the most efficient way possible.  They have also applied a specific formula to the Technology which limits the maximum temperature achievable depending on the application.  Thousands of tests ensure these parameters have been set correctly and you can produce consistent cooking results every time.

Why is the Mico range quicker at cooking than traditional methods?

Q: Why is baking a potato using Mico cookware faster than cooking in an oven?

A: This is directly linked to the inefficiency of regular appliance heating technologies or the general appliance architecture.  To cook a potato in an oven the entire oven space must be heated evenly.  It takes time to pre-heat the entire oven space and most of that space is wasted and this is costing you money!  Cooking a potato in an oven by convection alone takes much longer as the potato is cooked from the outside in and the potato skin acts a shield.  Mico uses microwaves to cook the inside of the potato first and then utilises Heatwave Technology to create a conduction/convection environment that creates that oven-baked crispy potato skin.

Q: Why do you remove the lid for the first 8 minutes of the cooking process when cooking a potato?

A: Cooking in a microwave oven can have its benefits over conduction and convection cooking as it heats up the water molecules of food.  This means it can cook the inside of a potato very quickly.  However, cooking in a microwave oven alone will result in a soggy wrinkled potato.  This is why for the last 10 minutes we suggest putting the lid back on to shield the potato from the microwaves to give that crisp yet fluffy perfect baked potato.

Q: Why is making a toasted sandwich using Mico cookware faster than cooking in a sandwich maker?

A: A sandwich toastie maker typically uses a radiating heating element which heats an aluminium plate indirectly.  As there is an air gap between the element and aluminium plate it takes a long time for the plate to heat up and heat evenly.  When food is added to the toastie maker the heat will be absorbed quickly and it takes a long time for the aluminium plate temperature to recover.  Mico’s Heatwave Technology directly covers the entire heating plate.  There is no need for a pre-heat phase as it instantly and continuously absorbs microwave energy to ensure the quickest possible heat up time and even heat distribution. 

Q: Why is frying an egg using Mico cookware faster than cooking in a pan?

A: Frying an egg typically means heating a frying pan.  Again the entire pan needs to be heated which takes additional time over Mico.  The heat-up time of the pan is directly linked to the type of hob you have (gas, electric or induction) and these can vary dramatically.  The heat distribution in the pan is also linked to the type of hob you have.  Mico Egg could not be easier to use.  To fry simply add a drop of oil, add the egg and Heatwave Technology will do the rest.  The oil will be heated in seconds drastically reducing the time to fry the egg to the desired consistency.

Q: Why is poaching an egg using Mico cookware faster than cooking in a pan?

Poaching an egg typically means heating a pan of water to the boil and then reducing to a simmer.  This can take several minutes and requires a lot of interaction with your appliance.  There is also a required skill level to achieve a perfectly poached egg and of course a further 4-5minutes to wait while the egg cooks.  Mico Egg could not be easier to use.  To poach simply add water to the fill line, add the egg and Heatwave Technology will do the rest.  The small amount of water will be heated to a simmer in seconds drastically reducing the time to poach.

How easy is the Mico range to use?

Q: Can I use the Mico range in an 800W microwave oven and how do the cooking times vary?

A: Mico can be used in any wattage microwave oven, you just need to adjust the cooking times using the guide provided.

Q: Do the elements have a non-stick coating?

A: Yes, all of the element plates in the Mico range have a non-stick coating making cleaning really easy.

Q:  Can I cook other foods in Mico products?

A:  In theory yes.  Heatwave Technology heats the element plates to around 200 to 240 degrees.  In theory there is no reason why different foods can’t be cooked.  We look forward to experimenting when more samples arrive so keep a look out for updates on this during the campaign!

Q:  Do I need to use any special cooking oil?

A:  No, you don’t need anything fancy.  Just a drop of regular vegetable or olive oil will do to fry an egg.  You could try rubbing salt and oil onto the potato before cooking to make it extra crispy.  Toasties always come out nice and crisp if the outside of the bread is buttered.

Q: How durable is Mico?

A: Mico housing is predominantly silicone which is very durable.  Dropping Mico would not be an issue.  Mico toastie does have a plastic clamp system which could break if repeatedly dropped at the wrong angle.

Q: How hot is the silicone housing after the cooking cycle?

A:  Mico’s silicone housing is a great insulating material and will protect you from the metal plates which can get very hot.  However, over longer cooking cycles some heat will be absorbed by the silicone so we would recommend using oven gloves when removing Mico Toastie and Potato.

Q: Can I put the Mico range into a dishwasher?

A: Yes the Mico range is fully dishwasher safe.

Q:  Can I use Mico products in my regular oven?

A:  No.  Mico uses Heatwave Technology which is specifically designed to only work in a microwave oven.

Do I have to stick with the suggested portion sizes?

Q:  Do I always have to cook two eggs in Mico Egg?

A:  No. You can cook one egg only if you want.  The cooking time might be slightly lower if only cooking one egg.

Q:  How many potatoes can I fit in Mico Potato?

A:  You can fit one large potato or two smaller potatoes. 

Q:  Can I use Mico Egg and Toastie in the microwave oven at the same time?

A:  In theory yes provided your microwave oven is large enough.  However, eggs will cook faster than a toastie.

Q:  Can I put two Mico toasties in a microwave oven at the same time?

A:  If your microwave oven is big enough then yes this is feasible.  Cooking times might be slightly longer if two toasties are cooked together.

 

WHAT IF I AM NOT HAPPY?

We really hope this is not the case as we can't wait to get these products into production and into your hands! If after you receive the products you have a problem with them then we will be happy to replace them like-for-like. Sadly though we will not be able to offer you a refund.

story:
Ask any craftsman—a good set of tools makes a world of difference in how they feel about their work. Cooking is the same. With sub-par tools, cooking can become a chore. With a great chef knife, the pleasure of cooking returns to the kitchen—even for the simplest of meals.

 

Introducing KAN Core

KAN is Japanese for intuition or 'sixth sense'. We set out to create a knife that was so sharp and agile, so well-balanced, and so perfectly weighted, that it feels like an extension of your hand. It should know what you want to do almost before you do.

Two years later, after trial and error and many iterations, we handed a KAN Core chef knife to the authority in all things cooking (and one of our idols), J. Kenji Lopez-Alt. Here's what he had to say about it:

 

Making a 'Dreamy' Knife (Blade, Balance, Beauty)

Blade

The core of the 7.9-inch (200mm) KAN Core chef knife is Japanese special steel AUS-10. The special makeup of AUS-10 allows for a high hardness (59-60 HRC) without becoming brittle. This means our blade can take a very sharp edge and retain it for a long time, yet it also avoids chipping easily.

This core is clad by 66 layers of Damascus stainless steel, giving it strength, corrosion resistance, as well as a beautiful, one-of-a-kind pattern.

Our steel is imported from Tsubame, Japan, hardened to 59-60 HRC, and shipped to you with a razor-sharp edge. With proper care, you won't need to sharpen very often, and you won't have a difficult time restoring the original edge when you do.

Balance

The first thing chefs do when you hand them a new chef knife is check to see if it is balanced properly. We balanced our knives right at the pinch point, so you intuitively use a blade grip (much safer, and much better control).

You'll immediately feel like you can create something special in the kitchen.

 Beauty

We wanted to make a knife that is as beautiful to look at as it is pleasurable to use. The Damascus pattern, hammered finish (optional) and your choice of a beautiful dark ebony wood handle or our G10 glass-based epoxy resin laminate handle all combine to create a work of art you'll be proud to have in your kitchen.

Ebony is both hard and beautiful, and most people prefer it over the G10 for its looks. We strongly recommend that you always hand-wash any good knife, then dry it immediately. That said, if you go with the G10 handle, it will never be affected by water, no matter how long you might soak it. Whichever you choose, you win with a beautiful seamless, full-tang symmetrical handle with no interrupting bolts or rivets.

 

For every knife you order, you will get a free flocking-lined blade guard!

 

 

 

 

About Us

Both of us are serial entrepreneurs with experience ranging from manufacturing engineering, to music, marketing, and software.

We love our kitchen gadgets. Immersion circulators, smokers, pizza stones, and Blendtec® blenders are all great for creating wonderful food, but more than anything else, we both love a really good knife. If you’ve never used one, we think you’re missing out.

The good news is, now is your chance to get a really high-end knife for a reasonable price. Please support us by choosing a KAN Core chef knife from the available rewards!
story_txt:
Ask any craftsman—a good set of tools makes a world of difference in how they feel about their work. Cooking is the same. With sub-par tools, cooking can become a chore. With a great chef knife, the pleasure of cooking returns to the kitchen—even for the simplest of meals.Bad tool, bad experience The KAN Core chef knife brings back the joy of cookingIntroducing KAN CoreKAN is Japanese for intuition or 'sixth sense'. We set out to create a knife that was so sharp and agile, so well-balanced, and so perfectly weighted, that it feels like an extension of your hand. It should know what you want to do almost before you do.Two years later, after trial and error and many iterations, we handed a KAN Core chef knife to the authority in all things cooking (and one of our idols), J. Kenji Lopez-Alt. Here's what he had to say about it: When Kenji approved, we knew we had arrived.  Making a 'Dreamy' Knife (Blade, Balance, Beauty)BladeThe core of the 7.9-inch (200mm) KAN Core chef knife is Japanese special steel AUS-10. The special makeup of AUS-10 allows for a high hardness (59-60 HRC) without becoming brittle. This means our blade can take a very sharp edge and retain it for a long time, yet it also avoids chipping easily.This core is clad by 66 layers of Damascus stainless steel, giving it strength, corrosion resistance, as well as a beautiful, one-of-a-kind pattern.To see what sharpness we're talking about, try this with one of your current knives.Our steel is imported from Tsubame, Japan, hardened to 59-60 HRC, and shipped to you with a razor-sharp edge. With proper care, you won't need to sharpen very often, and you won't have a difficult time restoring the original edge when you do.BalanceThe first thing chefs do when you hand them a new chef knife is check to see if it is balanced properly. We balanced our knives right at the pinch point, so you intuitively use a blade grip (much safer, and much better control).A well-balanced knife gives you ultimate control.You'll immediately feel like you can create something special in the kitchen.Please don't try this at home. BeautyEach knife will have a unique pattern created by the 67 layers.We wanted to make a knife that is as beautiful to look at as it is pleasurable to use. The Damascus pattern, hammered finish (optional) and your choice of a beautiful dark ebony wood handle or our G10 glass-based epoxy resin laminate handle all combine to create a work of art you'll be proud to have in your kitchen.Ebony is both hard and beautiful, and most people prefer it over the G10 for its looks. We strongly recommend that you always hand-wash any good knife, then dry it immediately. That said, if you go with the G10 handle, it will never be affected by water, no matter how long you might soak it. Whichever you choose, you win with a beautiful seamless, full-tang symmetrical handle with no interrupting bolts or rivets.Choose a finish: Hammered/Non-hammered Choose a handle: Ebony/G10 For every knife you order, you will get a free flocking-lined blade guard! Clean and dry your knife thoroughly before inserting it heel-first into the blade guard, like this. Take it from an expert, Chef Nathan Powers. The KAN Core chef knife has been very well received so far.  About UsBoth of us are serial entrepreneurs with experience ranging from manufacturing engineering, to music, marketing, and software.We love our kitchen gadgets. Immersion circulators, smokers, pizza stones, and Blendtec® blenders are all great for creating wonderful food, but more than anything else, we both love a really good knife. If you’ve never used one, we think you’re missing out.The good news is, now is your chance to get a really high-end knife for a reasonable price. Please support us by choosing a KAN Core chef knife from the available rewards!
 
 
Get Your Project Funded Today!
Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!

story:
About The Project

This device was originally thought when one day I was trying to find a way that my son will be always protected over any dangerous situation, and this way also help other kids to be protected whenever they need it.

This Campaign is very important to me because I really want to protect kids from any danger they might encounter.


About Me

I have a one year old son which is everything to me ( just like any parent ). Before coming to U.S, I was studying Law and Criminal Justice with the idea of helping people with their problems and solving cases of abuse and rape. I was always interested on solving this particular cases because I can't stand that people that are helpless suffer from such a horrible situation.

I came here to U.S to support my husband on his job I got pregnant and we have a beautiful baby, which I love with all my hearth. Each time I go to Walmart I see the signs of lost people (kids and adults), and remember the cases that I read when I was studying in my country I thought:

A lot of parents work, and don't have much control over their children. Young children and even older kids can be vulnerable over different situation were they don't have control or feel fear and don't react the best way.

If we look at the news we can see that daily there are different cases of bullying, kidnap, rape, theft, etc..., and people doesn't react the way they think they will when they encounter this situations that's why I design and am doing this device that will help anyone that needs help. My project is thought to be an assist the people ( not only children) that are involve in this kind of situations.

What We Need & What You Get

We (my husband and me) already started the design phase and put into it effort, money and time because we believe in this device and we are 200% sure that this is going to be a big success and we want you all to be part of this great project.

We haven't came with an actual production cost for the project because the prototype is always more expensive than the actual product ( we don't want to overcharge or give perks for unreasonable prices, but we will be giving away stuff as we progress on the project ).

So far in the project we have done 3d models, functionality break down, and other features that it will have to make it unique and useful.

If we don't meet out goal we will still be doing the project because we believe and support it. We might have delays on the process, but at the end we will have it done because we really want to do this device to help children and people to have help when they don't know how to react in dangerous situations.


Functionality of the Device

This device will have a hidden camera ( on the model is a red dot just to show the location ) that is specifically located to be able to take pictures of attacker and locations to be easy to recognize locations.

The device will have a GPS to show exact location of the user, also it will give specific signals after the alarm is activated to record every minute the new location of the user giving that way a full detail of the path that the user is having in case of kidnap.

The device works just like a normal watch that way it will work as a escort or spy that go with you and will help you be located and assisted in matter of minutes.


The Impact

This project is going to have a big impact on the world because this problem have not only presence here on U.S is something that we can see in any place of the world were people is kidnap, rape, or have situations were it will be very helpful to have something to alert someone that you need help and that way call the police or someone that might help them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Pray for the people that disappear and at this moment are far away from their home, so they can be found soon.
  • Share this page. Maybe someone else you know can help!


Thanks for your time.

story:
Gigabit to the Home

We are very excited to be the first ISP to bring Gigabit to individual homes in San Francisco!

Fiber to the home isn't happening anytime soon but MonkeyBrains is ready to deploy gigabit wireless today.  We will deploy a network of 80GHz links. We have already deployed over 50 links of this type to commercial buildings, and now we want to share our insane bandwidth with residential customers.  Our goal is to create a rapid and repeatable deployment system that creates a high speed mesh for residential neighborhoods.

The gigabit customers will pay our standard residential rates ($35/month) for Internet.

MonkeyBrains needs to amass a minimum order of 100 links to make this possible.

Let's do this San Francisco!

We need a lot of people to want this at once

MonkeyBrains needs to amass an order of about 100 links to make this affordable.  We'll get a price break from our vendor, and we will take the time to train all our techs in deploying high end 80GHz links.

An alternative Network for San Francisco

This project will have several impacts.  Most obvious is that you will get a high end link to your home.  Less obvious will be the strengthening of our core network and the ability to have more high speed fail-over pathways.  Also, we'll be able to service more areas of SF and boost capacity in already served neighborhoods.  There is also the altruistic aspect of donating double a link cost -- we will deploy in an area with lower medium incomes and grow our networks in those areas: helping us grow helps bridge the digital divide and fosters a San Francisco based company.


Open WIFI add on

If you can't afford the perk level of $2500 for a high end link to your home, that is OK.  A donation of $100 funds an open access point situated on a high end link.  There will be no username and no password -- look for an SSID of MonkeyBrains.net
